document_data.name: ''Volo's Guide to Spirits and Spectres''
document_data.author: [[Volothamp Geddarm]]
document_data.mainbody: '''''Volo's Guide to Spirits and Spectres''''' was a manuscript penned by [[Volothamp Geddarm]], available in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Contents: In its unfinished state, the [[book]] was nothing more than a barely-legible draft that focused on spirits (the alcohol kind). Some of the items listed in the book were: [[ghost]], [[banshee]], [[poltergeist]], and "spooky". All were, presumably, recipes of alcoholic drinks. One of these libations called for a full mug of ice, half a mug of distilled [[potato]] spirits, and three thimbles of citrus [[juice]]. The drink was served with a garnish of [[mint]].
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, this work was still an early manuscript, carried by its author, Volothamp Geddarm, during his venture to the [[Western Heartlands]] and investigation of the [[Cult of the Absolute]].
